title: Characterizing Public Sentiments and Drug Interactions during COVID-19: A Pretrained Language Model and Network Analysis of Social Media Discourse
details: W Li, Y Hua, P Zhou, Z Li, X Xu, J Yang - medRxiv, 2024
abstract: Objective: Harnessing drug-related data posted on social media in real time can offer insights into how the pandemic impacts drug use and monitor misinformation. This study developed a natural language processing (NLP) pipeline tailored for the …

title: From Deep Neural Language Models to LLMs
details: A Kucharavy - Large Language Models in Cybersecurity, 2024
abstract: Abstract Large Language Models (LLMs) are scaled-up instances of Deep Neural Language Models—a type of Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools trained with Machine Learning (ML). To best understand how LLMs work, we must dive into what …
